title: Augusta County: James R. McCutchan to His Sister, March 19, 1862
summary: After describing the retreat from Winchester, McCutchan declares his intention to keep fighting, even though he will not officially reenlist. He notes that "this is the darkest hour of the Confederacy," and discusses the need for southern patriotic spirit and determination.
keywords: Battle Description, Camp Life, Enlistment, Family, Military Authority, Military Strategy, Patriotism, Troop Movement, Women, American Civil War
